## Description {#details}

Insert wait instructions for memory reads and writes.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/memory">Memory</a> reads and writes are issued asynchronously, so we need to insert S&#95;WAITCNT instructions when we want to access any of their results or overwrite any register that&#39;s used asynchronously.

TODO: This pass currently keeps one timeline per hardware counter. A more finely-grained approach that keeps one timeline per event type could sometimes get away with generating weaker s&#95;waitcnt instructions. For example, when both SMEM and LDS are in flight and we need to wait for the i-th-last LDS instruction, then an lgkmcnt(i) is actually sufficient, but the pass will currently generate a conservative lgkmcnt(0) because multiple event types are in flight.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This objects maintains the current score brackets of each wait counter, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a per-register scoreboard for each wait counter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We also maintain the latest score for every event type that can change the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// waitcnt in order to know if there are multiple types of events within</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the brackets. When multiple types of event happen in the bracket,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// wait count may get decreased out of order, therefore we need to put in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;s&#95;waitcnt 0&quot; before use.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a346ebb0249f57a1f637b365cf0d250c0">WaitcntBrackets</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Edits an existing sequence of wait count instructions according</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to an incoming Waitcnt value, which is itself updated to reflect</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any new wait count instructions which may need to be generated by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// WaitcntGenerator::createNewWaitcnt(). It will return true if any edits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// were made.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This editing will usually be merely updated operands, but it may also</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// delete instructions if the incoming Wait value indicates they are not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// needed. It may also remove existing instructions for which a wait</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The number of outstanding events for this type, T, can be calculated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of outstanding events, then the wait for this counter is redundant.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a845e08be4b0320d66901a66b0c0e9509">Count</a> &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a0be60a3df71875c3240619489d10ec4f">getScoreRange</a>(T))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a845e08be4b0320d66901a66b0c0e9509">Count</a> = ~0u;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a285b6a653ad2b8ffe32d2ba0c4a66038"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a285b6a653ad2b8ffe32d2ba0c4a66038">WaitcntBrackets::determineWait</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a871adff9f76dede83762790959bc8e7b">InstCounterType</a> T, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/#a2a0d0a57d96de39f44474a411f386d85">RegInterval</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/msf/mappedblockstream-cpp/#a4ab9bd667f674c16b2cee01ab8823644">Interval</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/amdgpu/waitcnt">AMDGPU::Waitcnt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a233737223c9a3dba810df5b91bc91d1fa49bfe5e1e40e44e387a5e03c6ca759c5">Wait</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LB = <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#a51971ae9582c2d884bc84eef8498e243">getScoreLB</a>(T);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RegNo = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/msf/mappedblockstream-cpp/#a4ab9bd667f674c16b2cee01ab8823644">Interval</a>.first; RegNo &lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/msf/mappedblockstream-cpp/#a4ab9bd667f674c16b2cee01ab8823644">Interval</a>.second; ++RegNo) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ScoreToWait = <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets/#ad6cd92b8b96ec1c43da17757bb46b24c">getRegScore</a>(RegNo, T);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the score of src&#95;operand falls within the bracket, we need an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// s&#95;waitcnt instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((UB &gt;= ScoreToWait) &amp;&amp; (ScoreToWait &gt; LB)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If there is a pending FLAT operation, and this is a VMem or LGKM</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// waitcnt and the target can report early completion, then we need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><Highlight kind="comment">///  Generate s&#95;waitcnt instruction to be placed before cur&#95;Inst.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><Highlight kind="comment">///  Instructions of a given type are returned in order,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><Highlight kind="comment">///  but instructions of different types can complete out of order.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><Highlight kind="comment">///  We rely on this in-order completion</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><Highlight kind="comment">///  and simply assign a score to the memory access instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><Highlight kind="comment">///  We keep track of the active &quot;score bracket&quot; to determine</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><Highlight kind="comment">///  if an access of a memory read requires an s&#95;waitcnt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><Highlight kind="comment">///  and if so what the value of each counter is.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><Highlight kind="comment">///  The &quot;score bracket&quot; is bound by the lower bound and upper bound</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610"><Highlight kind="comment">///  scores (&#42;&#95;score&#95;LB and &#42;&#95;score&#95;ub respectively).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><Highlight kind="comment">///  If FlushVmCnt is true, that means that we want to generate a s&#95;waitcnt to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612"><Highlight kind="comment">///  flush the vmcnt counter here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a8a42c531875f7db92f2c697b823654b5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a8a42c531875f7db92f2c697b823654b5">SIInsertWaitcnts::generateWaitcntInstBefore</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/waitcntbrackets">WaitcntBrackets</a> &amp;ScoreBrackets,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1615"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;OldWaitcntInstr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1616"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> FlushVmCnt) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1617"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-siinsertwaitcnts-cpp-/siinsertwaitcnts/#a90a2b453bf3ce25f979403d9d95c7070">setForceEmitWaitcnt</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2080"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2081"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2082"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> WaitcntBrackets::mergeScore(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MergeInfo &amp;M, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Score,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2083"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OtherScore) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2084"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MyShifted = Score &lt;= M.OldLB ? 0 : Score + M.MyShift;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2085"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OtherShifted =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2086"><Highlight kind="normal">      OtherScore &lt;= M.OtherLB ? 0 : OtherScore + M.OtherShift;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2087"><Highlight kind="normal">  Score = std::max(MyShifted, OtherShifted);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2088"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> OtherShifted &gt; MyShifted;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2089"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2090"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2091"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Merge the pending events and associater score brackets of \\p Other into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2092"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this brackets status.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2093"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2094"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns whether the merge resulted in a change that requires tighter waits</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2095"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (i.e. the merged brackets strictly dominate the original brackets).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RestoreVCCZ = !VCCZCorrect &amp;&amp; <a href="#a94ceb20d45e28266a8e3c88177cd5433">readsVCCZ</a>(Inst);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ST-&gt;hasReadVCCZBug() || !ST-&gt;partialVCCWritesUpdateVCCZ()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Up to gfx9, writes to vcc&#95;lo and vcc&#95;hi don&#39;t update vccz.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!ST-&gt;partialVCCWritesUpdateVCCZ())</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Inst.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a9024bfb74506b66f45d153234a802000">definesRegister</a>(AMDGPU::VCC, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;TRI=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There is a hardware bug on CI/SI where SMRD instruction may corrupt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vccz bit, so when we detect that an instruction may read from a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2218"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// corrupt vccz bit, we need to:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2219"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 Insert s&#95;waitcnt lgkm(0) to wait for all outstanding SMRD</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2220"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    operations to complete.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2221"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 Restore the correct value of vccz by writing the current value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2222"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    of vcc back to vcc.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2223"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ST-&gt;hasReadVCCZBug() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2225"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Writes to vcc while there&#39;s an outstanding smem read may get</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 The loop contains vmem load(s), but the loaded values are not used in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
